[int][bug][ble] modify rw timer to soft timer
Project: Bluetooth
redmine: #5438, REDMINE-5438
ext-redmine: bug|feat#id
[Description in detail] 1. Avoid entering interrupts
Affected branch: [master]
Change-Id: I5877f19e7db38bf88dacb097d762a76e4b20160f

ext-redmine: bug|feat#id

Affected branch: [master]

[new][audio_v1_mic] Add the UAC demo
redmine: #7409, REDMINE-7409
ext-redmine: #i7409, REDMINE-7409
[Description in detail] Implement USB microphone recording function based on USB audio class
Change-Id: I73549e4e4163491fe75f033ac79b1a46a8d546d7

[new][adc] 55x support use adc_max_voltage value based on vol10 bit15 and vol25 bit15
redmine: #id, REDMINE-id
ext-redmine: #7305, REDMINE-7305
[Description in detail] 1.when 55x vol10 bit15=0 or vol25 bit15=0, adc_max_voltage = 3300; 2.when 55x vol10 bit15=1 and vol25 bit15=1, adc_max_voltage = 1100;
Change-Id: Ia24b061485e5c5d0432e917fe46758466ddda6b8

[chore][board] Add dfu support of board 52-lcd_a128r16 and 52-nano_a128r16
ext-redmine: #7066, REDMINE-7066
[Description in detail]
Change-Id: I69c1728d4d0a7ab54e39784d8f2b7f11019e8b39

[opt][docs] Use `sphinx_selective_exclude` extension to make `only` directive work in an expected and intuitive manner
ext-redmine: #101, REDMINE-101
[Description in detail] According to Sphinx doc, `only` directive has some limitations, it's designed to control only content of document. It could not control sections, labels and so on. `sphinx_select_exclude` package provides `eager_only` extension to solve these issues. So `only` directive can be used to control sections and `toctree`.
Change-Id: I46307f634340b437d8e0ad98d65b3a0583b2ab85

[opt][build] Disable GCC strict-aliasing to avoid undefined behavior for pointer aliasing
ext-redmine: #7286, REDMINE-7286
[Description in detail]
Change-Id: I48ec1583dde8ea8b8685ae3858dcbe430e7128fd

[bug][board] No need to enable NON_OTP as external NOR Flash is available
ext-redmine: #7066, REDMINE-7066
[Description in detail]
Change-Id: I5bae38d5901eb3ac6345729ecc2138a4159a6620

[opt][build] Add LINKFLAGS_POST variable to support user-defined link flags
ext-redmine: #7346, REDMINE-7346
[Description in detail] LINKFLAGS_POST is put just before _LIBFLAGS and inside --start-group/--end-group pair like below
env["LINKCOM"] = "${TEMPFILE('$LINK -o $EXPANDED_TARGETS $LINKFLAGS $__RPATH $EXPANDED_SOURCES $EXPANDED_LDIR -Wl,--start-group $LINKFLAGS_POST $_LIBFLAGS -Wl,--end-group ','$LINKCOMSTR')}"
Usage: LINKFLAGS_POST = [ '-Wl,--whole-archive', '-ldemo1_gcc', '-Wl,--no-whole-archive', ] env.Append(LINKFLAGS_POST=LINKFLAGS_POST)
Change-Id: I78ca562de8129f7313ec89168e4ebf8baba8d2d6

[chore][ci] Add 52-core and 52-nano board in CI
ext-redmine: #101, REDMINE-101
[Description in detail]
Change-Id: I5b5a9a375b7ea7b42f6bb830a0713affd274dde7

[opt][docs] Use `sphinx_selective_exclude` extension to make `only` directive work in an expected and intuitive manner
ext-redmine: #101, REDMINE-101
[Description in detail] According to Sphinx doc, `only` directive has some limitations, it's designed to control only content of document. It could not control sections, labels and so on. `sphinx_select_exclude` package provides `eager_only` extension to solve these issues. So `only` directive can be used to control sections and `toctree`.
Change-Id: Icb01f68f2a004872b700e0b2b02daa1bcd129ca3

[opt][build] Add LINKFLAGS_POST variable to support user-defined link flags
ext-redmine: #7346, REDMINE-7346
[Description in detail] LINKFLAGS_POST is put just before _LIBFLAGS and inside --start-group/--end-group pair like below
env["LINKCOM"] = "${TEMPFILE('$LINK -o $EXPANDED_TARGETS $LINKFLAGS $__RPATH $EXPANDED_SOURCES $EXPANDED_LDIR -Wl,--start-group $LINKFLAGS_POST $_LIBFLAGS -Wl,--end-group ','$LINKCOMSTR')}"
Usage: LINKFLAGS_POST = [ '-Wl,--whole-archive', '-ldemo1_gcc', '-Wl,--no-whole-archive', ] env.Append(LINKFLAGS_POST=LINKFLAGS_POST)
Change-Id: I78ca562de8129f7313ec89168e4ebf8baba8d2d6
